column2: # the aesthetic 'fill = morph_colour' was used here because we want to see our geometry output as a bar, and these bars can be filled with a colour. Using 'colour = morph_colour' will alter the outlines of the bar, so not advisable to use that aesthetic
#stat = 'identity' tells ggplot not to make any calculations
#position = 'dodge' helped us to have the two bars for habitat group next to each other; if we didn't specify that, we would have a stacked barplot
